instructions.step_2: In a large mixing bowl, combine the uncooked rice, cream of mushroom soup, water, salt, and black pepper.
instructions.step_3: Add the cooked shredded chicken and frozen peas to the mixture. Stir until well combined.
instructions.step_4: Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
instructions.step_5: Dot the top with butter and sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese evenly over the casserole.
instructions.step_6: Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 45 minutes.
instructions.step_7: Remove the foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly and golden brown.
instructions.step_8: Let the casserole rest for 5 minutes before serving.

instructions.step_2: In a large bowl, mix together the cooked macaroni, steamed broccoli, cream of cheese soup, milk, half of the shredded cheddar cheese, salt, and garlic powder.
instructions.step_3: Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
instructions.step_4: Sprinkle the remaining cheddar cheese over the top.
instructions.step_5: In a separate bowl, combine the breadcrumbs and melted butter. Sprinkle this mixture evenly over the casserole.
instructions.step_6: Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the casserole is bubbly.
instructions.step_7: Allow to cool for 5 minutes before serving.

instructions.step_2: In a large skillet, cook ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat.
instructions.step_3: Add diced onions and minced garlic to the skillet. Sauté until onions are translucent.
instructions.step_4: Stir in tomato sauce, diced tomatoes, salt, black pepper, and paprika. Let simmer for 15 minutes.
instructions.step_5: In a greased 9x13-inch baking dish, layer half of the sliced potatoes.
instructions.step_6: Spread the beef mixture evenly over the potatoes.
instructions.step_7: Layer the remaining potatoes on top of the beef mixture.
instructions.step_8: Sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese over the casserole.
instructions.step_9: Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 1 hour.
instructions.step_10: Remove the foil, sprinkle with additional cheddar cheese if desired, and bake for another 15 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.
instructions.step_11: Allow to cool for 10 minutes before serving.

instructions.step_2: In a large bowl, combine cooked egg noodles, drained tuna, cream of mushroom soup, milk, frozen peas, half of the shredded cheddar cheese, salt, and black pepper.
instructions.step_3: Mix until all ingredients are well incorporated.
instructions.step_4: Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
instructions.step_5: Sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese and breadcrumbs evenly over the top.
instructions.step_6: Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the casserole is heated through.
instructions.step_7: Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

instructions.step_2: In a large mixing bowl, combine green beans, cream of chicken soup, milk, soy sauce, black pepper, garlic powder, and half of the shredded cheddar cheese.
instructions.step_3: Stir in 2/3 cup of french fried onions.
instructions.step_4: Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
instructions.step_5: Sprinkle the remaining cheddar cheese over the top.
instructions.step_6: In a separate bowl, combine the remaining french fried onions with a little melted butter if desired and sprinkle over the casserole.
instructions.step_8: Remove from oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

instructions.step_2: In a large skillet, cook ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat.
instructions.step_3: Add diced onions and minced garlic to the skillet. Sauté until onions are translucent.
instructions.step_4: Stir in tomato sauce, dried basil, salt, and black pepper. Let simmer for 15 minutes.
instructions.step_5: In a separate bowl, combine ricotta cheese, egg, half of the shredded mozzarella, and half of the grated parmesan cheese.
instructions.step_6: In a greased 9x13-inch baking dish, spread a thin layer of the meat sauce.
instructions.step_7: Layer 4 cooked lasagna noodles over the sauce.
instructions.step_8: Spread half of the ricotta cheese mixture over the noodles.
instructions.step_9: Repeat the layers: meat sauce, noodles, ricotta mixture.
instructions.step_10: Top the final layer of noodles with the remaining meat sauce.
instructions.step_11: Sprinkle the remaining mozzarella and parmesan cheeses over the top.
instructions.step_12: Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes.
instructions.step_13: Remove the foil and bake for an additional 25 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly and golden.
instructions.step_14: Let the lasagna casserole rest for 10 minutes before serving.

instructions.step_2: In a large skillet, cook ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat.
instructions.step_3: Add diced onions and minced garlic to the skillet. Sauté until onions are translucent.
instructions.step_4: Stir in marinara sauce, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper. Let simmer for 10 minutes.
instructions.step_5: In a mixing bowl, combine ricotta cheese with half of the shredded mozzarella and half of the grated parmesan cheese.
instructions.step_6: In a greased 9x13-inch baking dish, layer half of the cooked ziti pasta.
instructions.step_7: Spread half of the ricotta cheese mixture over the pasta.
instructions.step_8: Repeat the layers: meat sauce, ziti pasta, ricotta mixture.
instructions.step_9: Top the casserole with the remaining mozzarella and parmesan cheeses.
instructions.step_10: Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 20 minutes.
instructions.step_11: Remove the foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
instructions.step_12: Let the baked ziti casserole cool for 5 minutes before serving.

ingredients.spinach: 2 cups, fresh or frozen (if frozen, thaw and squeeze out excess moisture)

instructions.step_2: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
instructions.step_3: Add cooked Italian sausage slices to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes.
instructions.step_4: Stir in marinara sauce, spinach, salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes if using. Let simmer for 5 minutes.
instructions.step_5: In a mixing bowl, combine ricotta cheese with half of the shredded mozzarella and half of the grated parmesan cheese.
instructions.step_6: In a greased 9x13-inch baking dish, layer half of the cooked penne pasta.
instructions.step_7: Spread half of the ricotta cheese mixture over the pasta.
instructions.step_8: Pour half of the sausage and marinara mixture over the ricotta layer.
instructions.step_9: Repeat the layers: penne pasta, ricotta mixture, sausage and marinara sauce.
instructions.step_10: Top the casserole with the remaining mozzarella and parmesan cheeses.
instructions.step_11: Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes.
instructions.step_12: Remove the foil and bake uncovered for an additional 15 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly and golden.
instructions.step_13: Let the sausage and penne casserole cool for 5 minutes before serving.

ingredients.black_beans: 2 cans (15 oz each), drained and rinsed

instructions.step_2: In a large pot, boil sweet potato cubes until tender, about 15-20 minutes. Drain and set aside.
instructions.step_3: In a large skillet, sauté diced onion and bell pepper over medium heat until softened, about 5 minutes.
instructions.step_4: Add minced garlic, cumin, chili powder, salt, and black pepper to the skillet. Cook for another 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
instructions.step_5: Stir in black beans, corn, and tomato sauce. Cook for 5 minutes, allowing flavors to meld.
instructions.step_6: In a greased 9x13-inch baking dish, spread half of the boiled sweet potatoes.
instructions.step_7: Pour half of the black bean and corn mixture over the sweet potatoes.
instructions.step_8: Repeat the layers with the remaining sweet potatoes and black bean mixture.
instructions.step_9: Sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese evenly over the top of the casserole.
instructions.step_10: Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 20 minutes.
instructions.step_11: Remove the foil and bake uncovered for an additional 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
instructions.step_12: Garnish with sliced green onions and chopped cilantro before serving.

instructions.step_2: In a large bowl, combine shredded chicken, cooked egg noodles, cream of roast beef soup, buffalo sauce, ranch dressing, diced celery, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.
instructions.step_3: Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
instructions.step_4: Sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese and blue cheese crumbles evenly over the top.
instructions.step_5: Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the casserole is heated through.
instructions.step_6: Garnish with sliced green onions before serving.

instructions.step_2: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add diced onion and minced garlic, sauté until translucent.
instructions.step_3: Add cubed butternut squash to the skillet. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
instructions.step_4: Stir in quinoa, vegetable broth, fresh sage leaves, salt, and black pepper. Bring to a boil.
instructions.step_5: Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes, or until quinoa and squash are tender.
instructions.step_6: Remove the skillet from heat and discard the sage leaves.
instructions.step_7: Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
instructions.step_8: Sprinkle grated parmesan cheese evenly over the top.
instructions.step_9: In a small bowl, mix panko breadcrumbs with melted butter. Sprinkle the breadcrumb mixture over the parmesan cheese.
instructions.step_10: Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and crispy.
instructions.step_11: Allow the casserole to cool for 5 minutes before serving.

instructions.step_2: In a large mixing bowl, combine softened cream cheese, sour cream, mayonnaise, and minced garlic. Mix until smooth.
instructions.step_3: Stir in thawed spinach and chopped artichoke hearts. Mix until well combined.
instructions.step_4: Add grated parmesan cheese, shredded mozzarella cheese, salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes if using. Stir to incorporate.
instructions.step_5: Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x9-inch baking dish.
instructions.step_6: In a small bowl, mix bread crumbs with melted butter. Sprinkle the breadcrumb mixture evenly over the top of the casserole.
instructions.step_7: Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the casserole is bubbly.
instructions.step_8: Allow to cool for 5 minutes before serving.
